title: Agilent’s Net-Zero Emissions Targets Approved by the Science Based Targets Initiative - ESG Today
summary: Agilent Technologies has had its near and long-term targets for reaching net-zero greenhouse gas emissions approved by the Science Based Targets initiative.  The company also launched a plan to reduce Scope 3 emissions in the supply chain, which includes creating a baseline of supplier emissions contributions, educating suppliers about net-zero targets, and planning workshops and forums to support their goal setting and progress.
green_innovation: TRUE, Agilent's near and long-term targets for reaching net-zero greenhouse gas emissions have been approved by the Science Based Targets initiative.  These targets support the ambitious goal to limit planetary warming to 1.5°C above pre-industrial levels.
business_innovation: FALSE, The article does not describe a product or process that meets the criteria to be a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE, Agilent has developed innovative lab products that reduce consumption of fossil fuels and solvents.
green_process: TRUE, Agilent has adopted greener packaging and expanded its instrument recycling and refurbishing program across its global operations.
product_or_process: innovative lab products, greener packaging, instrument recycling and refurbishing program

greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not provide any evidence that the described product or process innovation is an example of greenwashing.

title: Allegro MicroSystems Completes Acquisition of Crocus Technology to Accelerate Innovation in TMR Sensing Technology - GlobeNewswire
summary: Allegro MicroSystems, a global leader in power and sensing semiconductor technology, has acquired Crocus Technology, a leader in advanced Tunnel Magnetoresistance (TMR) sensor technology, for $420 million in cash.  TMR is the fastest growing technology in magnetic sensing with an estimated 30% CAGR through 2030.  This acquisition accelerates Allegro’s TMR roadmap and strengthens its leading position in the magnetic sensing market

title: Dabur India Achieves Cloud-First Status, Paving the Path to FMCG Excellence - Indian Retailer
summary: The article provides an overview of the luxury watch market in India, highlighting popular brands, their heritage, and the factors to consider when selecting a luxury watch. It also mentions the increasing popularity of ethical craftsmanship and sustainability in the industry.
